member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Public constructor for VirusTotal.
member.param: The API key you got from Virus Total

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.ScanFile(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Scan a file. Note: It is highly encouraged to get the report of the file before scanning, in case it has already been scanned before.
member.param: The file to scan

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.ScanFile(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Scan a file. Note: It is highly encouraged to get the report of the file before scanning, in case it has already been scanned before. Note: Ýou are also strongly encouraged to provide the filename as it is rich metadata for the Virus Total database.
member.param: The file to scan
The filename of the file

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.ScanFiles(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Tuple{System.Byte[],System.String}})
member.summary: Scan multiple files. Note: It is highly encouraged to get the report of the files before scanning, in case it they already been scanned before. Note: Ýou are also strongly encouraged to provide the filename as it is rich metadata for the Virus Total database.
member.param: The files you wish to scan. They are a tuple of file content and filename.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.ScanFiles(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.IO.FileInfo})
member.summary: Scan multiple files. Note: It is highly encouraged to get the report of the files before scanning, in case it they already been scanned before.
member.param: The files you wish to scan.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.RescanFile(System.String)
member.summary: Tell VirusTotal to rescan a file without sending the actual file to VirusTotal. Note: Before requesting a rescan you should retrieve the latest report on the file.
member.param: A hash of the file. It can be an MD5, SHA1 or SHA256

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.RescanFile(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Tell VirusTotal to rescan a file without sending the actual file to VirusTotal. Note: Before requesting a rescan you should retrieve the latest report on the file.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.RescanFile(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Tell VirusTotal to rescan a file without sending the actual file to VirusTotal. Note: Before requesting a rescan you should retrieve the latest report on the file.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.RescanFiles(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.IO.FileInfo})
member.summary: Tell VirusTotal to rescan a file. Note: This does not send the files to VirusTotal. It hashes the file and sends that instead. Note: Before requesting a rescan you should retrieve the latest report on the files.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.RescanFiles(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Byte[]})
member.summary: Tell VirusTotal to rescan a file. Note: This does not send the files to VirusTotal. It hashes the file and sends that instead. Note: Before requesting a rescan you should retrieve the latest report on the files.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.RescanFiles(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Tell VirusTotal to rescan a file. Note: This does not send the files to VirusTotal. It hashes the file and sends that instead. Note: Before requesting a rescan you should retrieve the latest report on the files. Note: You can use MD5, SHA1 or SHA256 and even mix them. Note: You can only request a maximum of 25 rescans.
member.param: a MD5, SHA1 or SHA256 of the files. You can also specify list made up of a combination of any of the three allowed hashes (up to 25 items), this allows you to perform a batch request with one single call. Note: that the files must already be present in the files store.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.GetFileReport(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Gets the report of the file. Note: This does not send the files to VirusTotal. It hashes the file and sends that instead.
member.param: The file you wish to get a report on.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.GetFileReport(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Gets the report of the file. Note: This does not send the files to VirusTotal. It hashes the file and sends that instead.
member.param: The file you wish to get a report on.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.GetFileReport(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the report of the file. Note: This does not send the files to VirusTotal. It hashes the file and sends that instead.
member.param: The resource (MD5, SHA1 or SHA256) you wish to get a report on.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.GetFileReports(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Byte[]})
member.summary: Gets a list of reports of the files. Note: This does not send the files to VirusTotal. It hashes the files and sends them instead.
member.param: The files you wish to get reports on.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.GetFileReports(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.IO.FileInfo})
member.summary: Gets a list of reports of the files. Note: This does not send the files to VirusTotal. It hashes the files and sends them instead.
member.param: The files you wish to get reports on.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.GetFileReports(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Gets the report of the file represented by its hash or scan ID. Keep in mind that URLs sent using the API have the lowest scanning priority, depending on VirusTotal's load, it may take several hours before the file is scanned, so query the report at regular intervals until the result shows up and do not keep submitting the file over and over again.
member.param: SHA1, MD5 or SHA256 of the file. It can also be a scan ID of a previous scan.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.ScanUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Scan the given URL. The URL will be downloaded by VirusTotal and processed. Note: Before performing your submission, you should retrieve the latest report on the URL.
member.param: The url to process.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.ScanUrl(System.Uri)
member.summary: Scan the given URL. The URL will be downloaded by VirusTotal and processed. Note: Before performing your submission, you should retrieve the latest report on the URL.
member.param: The url to process.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.ScanUrls(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Scan the given URLs. The URLs will be downloaded by VirusTotal and processed. Note: Before performing your submission, you should retrieve the latest reports on the URLs.
member.param: The urls to process.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.ScanUrls(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Uri})
member.summary: Scan the given URLs. The URLs will be downloaded by VirusTotal and processed. Note: Before performing your submission, you should retrieve the latest reports on the URLs.
member.param: The urls to process.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.GetUrlReport(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a scan report from an URL
member.param: The URL you wish to get the report on.
Set to true if you wish VirusTotal to scan the URL if it is not present in the database.

member.name: M:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.GetUrlReport(System.Uri,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a scan report from an URL
member.param: The URL you wish to get the report on.
Set to true if you wish VirusTotal to scan the URL if it is not present in the database.

member.summary: Gets a scan report from a list of URLs
member.param: The URLs you wish to get the reports on.
Set to true if you wish VirusTotal to scan the URLs if it is not present in the database.

member.summary: Gets a scan report from a list of URLs

Set to true if you wish VirusTotal to scan the URLs if it is not present in the database.

member.name: P:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.UseTLS
member.summary: Set to false to use HTTP instead of HTTPS. HTTPS is used by default.

member.name: P:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.Proxy
member.summary: Get or set the proxy.

member.name: P:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.Retry
member.summary: The number of retries to attempt if an serialization error happens. It is set to 3 by default.

member.name: P:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.Timeout
member.summary: Get or set the timeout in miliseconds.

member.name: P:VirusTotalNET.VirusTotal.ApiUrl
member.summary: The URL which the Virus Total service listens on. IF you don't set the scheme to http:// or https:// it will default to https.
